subject: Ethics
title: Stem Cell Research Controversies
description: A micro-lesson that makes Stem Cell Research Controversies usable.

hook.text: Cells that can become any organ in the body‚Äîheart, brain, liver. The catch? Where they come from.

buildup.text: Embryonic stem cells are harvested from days-old embryos, destroying them in the process.

discovery.text: These cells could regenerate damaged organs and cure diseases like Parkinson's and diabetes.

twist.text: If a five-day embryo has moral status, then destroying it for research is killing for science.

climax.text: The debate hinges on when moral status begins‚Äîconception, viability, or consciousness.

punchline.text: The tiniest cells raise the biggest question: when does life count?

quiz.question: What is the central ethical issue in embryonic stem cell research?
options: Harvesting embryonic stem cells destroys the embryo
Stem cells are too difficult to grow in labs
